answers.answer: Grid photocoagulation is usually done for diabetic macular edema or a retinal vein occlusion.  There are few other reasons to to do it so most of the people that have that treatment have one or the other problems.JCH MD

question: What is about a patient without diabetes nor retinal vein occlusion that makes him/her a higher risk for grid macular photocoagulation?Thank you!
title: grid or scater macular photocoagulation
